alert.note: Alert for Canovanas; Ceiba; Fajardo; Loiza; Luquillo; Rio Grande; Trujillo Alto (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued September 18 at 3:40PM ADT until September 18 at 6:00PM ADT by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON FOR CANOVANAS, CEIBA, FAJARDO, LOIZA, LUQUILLO, RIO GRANDE AND TRUJILLO ALTO COUNTIES... At 240 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain across the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts of 3 to 6 inches are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. So far, river sensors indicate that Rio Fajardo in Fajardo, Rio Mameyes in Luquillo, Rio Espiritu Santo in Rio Grande, and Rio Canovanillas in Canovanas are all in action stage and may overflow at any time. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Heavy rain producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Fajardo, Rio Grande, Luquillo, Canovanas, Ceiba, Carolina, Trujillo Alto, Hato Candal, La Dolores, Playa Fortuna, Campo Rico, Ramos, San Isidro, Santa Barbara, Aguas Claras, Luis M. Cintron, Roosevelt Roads, Bartolo, Palmer and Benitez. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.

area.areaDesc: Canovanas; Ceiba; Fajardo; Loiza; Luquillo; Rio Grande; Trujillo Alto
